ARABIC: رُدُّوهَا عَلَىَّ فَطَفِقَ مَسْحًۢا بِٱلسُّوقِ وَٱلْأَعْنَاقِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Return them to me!' And he set about slashing through their shanks and necks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Bring them back to me," and he began to rub and stroke their shanks and necks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: (he ordered): “Bring these horses back to me,” and then he began to gently stroke their shanks and necks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: He said, "Bring them back to me." Then he started to rub their legs and necks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: He then ordered, “Bring them back to me”; and he began caressing their shins and necks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Then he said: "Bring them back to me." Then he began to pass his hand over their legs and their necks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Bring them back to me; so he began to slash (their) legs and necks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Return them to me!' And he began to stroke their shanks and necks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: (Then he said): Bring them back to me, and fell to slashing (with his sword their) legs and necks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Bring them back to me!" -- [he said] and began to stroke their legs and their necks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Bring them back Unto me; and he set about slashing their legs and necks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: ‘Bring it back for me!’ Then he [and others] began to wipe [their] legs and necks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Bring them back to me." then began he to pass his hand over (their) legs and their necks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Then he said "Bring them (horses) back to me." Then he began to pass his hand over their legs and their necks (till the end of the display).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Bring them back to me' And he hacked their legs and necks (slaughtering them for Allah).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Bring them back to me.” And he began caressing their legs and necks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [He said], "Return them to me," and set about striking [their] legs and necks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [38:33] Bring them back to me!, that is, the horses that were displayed; and they so brought them back. Then he set about slashing, with his sword, [their] legs (al-sūq is the plural of sāq) and necks, in other words, he slaughtered them and cut off their legs as an offering [of atonement] to God, exalted be He, for having been distracted by them from the prayer. He gave all the meat thereof as voluntary alms and so God compensated him what was better and faster that these [horses], and this was the wind, which blew at his command as he wished.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: ((Then he said): Bring them back to me) bring back whatever was shown to me, (and fell to slashing (with his sword their) legs and necks) it is also said that he began slashing their necks and legs until the sun disappeared and he missed the 'Asr prayer; this is why he did what he did.
